summary: there were 5327 SARS cases from November 2002 to May 2003 in Mainland China, which involved 29 provinces. there were 349 deaths, and directly caused economic losses of $18.3 billion. the findings constitute valuable input to prevent and control future seriousness. electronic supplementary material 12879_2014_721_MOESM1_ESM.doc (46KB, doc) Additional file 1: Table S1.: Epidemiological interpretation of SARS in-out flow data. (DOC 52 KB) 12879_2014_721_MOESM7_ESM.doc (59KB, doc) Additional file 7: Figure S10: Frequency distributions of the SARS flow and total SARS cases by occupations.
